Description: Shoulder sherd of East Greek Wild Goat Style black-figured pottery amphora or oinochoe; exterior, dull yellowish slip: from top, in frieze, part of a spread black palmette petal and black-figure goat grazing to right (one hind leg remaining with added red); rosette as filling ornament; below, broken maeander pattern between wide black bands with traces of superimposed added red band; below, trace of undetermined motif.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.058)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Purchased in Cairo by M. Jean de Mot
